title: Russia to put nukes near Belarus' western border, envoy says
description: Russia’s ambassador to Belarus says that Moscow will deploy tactical nuclear weapons close to Belarus’ border with NATO neighbors

title: Jodie Comer, Paul Mescal take acting gold at Olivier Awards
description: Screen stars Paul Mescal and Jodie Comer have won prizes at London’s Olivier Awards for their first-ever West End stage roles

title: Winners of the London stage 2023 Olivier Awards
description: Winners of the 2023 Olivier Awards, handed out Sunday for achievement in London theater, opera and dance include: “My Neighbor Totoro,” which won six prizes including best new comedy and best director

title: Russian blogger who pushed for Ukraine war dies in cafe explosion
description: Vladlen Tatarsky, one of the most prominent pro-Kremlin military bloggers, has died in an explosion in St. Petersburg that injured 16 others.

title: Israel to form national guard proposed by far-right minister Ben Gvir
description: The new national guard is the brainchild of cabinet minister Itamar Ben Gvir, a far-right former activist and settler.

title: Kenya's opposition calls off anti-government protests
description: Kenyan opposition leader Raila Odinga has called for a temporary halt to anti-government protests after President William Ruto urged his opponents to negotiate with him

title: Taiwan's president wraps up Guatemala visit, heads to Belize
description: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen and Guatemalan President Alejandro Giammattei have toured a hospital built with support from Taipei, reaffirming their close diplomatic ties as the self-governing island seeks to strengthen relations with its remaining allies in Central America

title: Israeli government dismisses antisemitism envoy
description: Israel’s antisemitism envoy says she was fired by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government, citing her criticism of its planned judicial overhaul as a possible cause

title: Ukraine live briefing: Blinken calls for U.S. journalist’s release; explosion kills pro-Kremlin military blogger
description: In a call with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken urged Russia to release journalist Evan Gershkovich.

title: Pakistan denies Israel trade after businessman's export
description: Pakistan says there is no trade with Israel after a Jewish businessman in the southern city of Karachi went viral for tweeting about his first kosher food export

title: Ukraine puts Orthodox priest under house arrest for Russia ties
description: The move by Ukraine to detain Metropolitan Pavlo, a prominent cleric, showed the extent to which the war has deepened rifts within the Orthodox Church.

title: Rebounding Pope Francis marks Palm Sunday in Vatican square
description: Pope Francis has presided over his first ceremony in St. Peter’s Square following a three-day hospitalization for bronchitis

title: Algerian court sentences prominent journalist to 5 years
description: A court in Algiers sentenced a prominent journalist to five years in prison with two years suspended on Sunday

title: Japanese musician Ryuichi Sakamoto dies at 71
description: Ryuichi Sakamoto, a world-renowned Japanese musician and actor who composed for Hollywood hits such as “The Last Emperor” and “The Revenant,” has died

title: UK seeks to contact 3 British men detained in Afghanistan
description: The U.K. government says it is seeking to make contact with three British nationals detained by the Taliban in Afghanistan

title: Christian faithful mark Palm Sunday in Jerusalem
description: Thousands of Christian pilgrims have participated in Palm Sunday celebrations in Jerusalem at the start of the Holy Week

title: Ryuichi Sakamoto, eclectic composer who saw no borders, dies at 71
description: In a busy and manifold career, he also scored films including “Merry Christmas, Mr. Lawrence” and the Oscar-winning “The Last Emperor.”

title: Activists' network in Mexico helps U.S. women get abortions
description: A network of abortion-rights activists in Mexico is finding ways to offer assistance -- including shipments of abortion pills -- to women in the United States affected by recently imposed abortion bans in several states

title: Burundi: At least 13 gold miners killed in flooded pits
description: An official in Burundi says the bodies of 13 gold miners have been recovered from two pits in which they were trapped by flood water

title: In old, feel-good story, Putin bought teacher an apartment. He didn’t.
description: Records show that an offshore account controlled by Roman Abramovich paid for an apartment for Vladimir Putin's former teacher, upending a myth about the Russian president

title: Israeli strikes in Syria's Homs province wound 5 soldiers
description: Syrian state media says Israeli airstrikes have hit several sites in Syria’s Homs province, wounding five soldiers

title: Mozambique works to contain cholera outbreak after cyclone
description: Weeks after massive Cyclone Freddy hit Mozambique for a second time, the still-flooded country is facing a spiraling cholera outbreak that threatens to add to the devastation
